direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve removing elements from the composite set, but removeAll removes a collection of elements while remove removes a single element.
Both methods modify the composite set by removing elements, but retainAll retains only the elements in the specified collection.
Both methods involve removing elements based on a condition, but removeIf uses a predicate to determine which elements to remove.
Both methods modify the composite set by removing elements, but clear removes all elements while remove removes a specific element.
Both methods involve removing elements or sets from the composite, but removeComposited removes an entire set from the composite.
